result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond A. Tourtillott

defendant.name: Tourtillott, Raymond A.
defendant.address: P. O. Box 1268   N592 Brooks Lane, Keshena, WI 54135

records.addlTxt:
1:47 PM Defendant Raymond A. Tourtillott appeared by video, in custody in Shawano County Jail.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court for Raymond A. Tourtillott.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court notes only calling case no 22CF10 today, CM status conferences track along. Atty Jansen reviews case history and waives time limits on P.H. Court questions Def. on waiving time limits for P.H. Def. agrees to waive time limits. Court accepts waiver of time limits on P.H. State requests status conference. State has complied with victim rights. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:24 PM Defendant Raymond A. Tourtillott not in court.  Attorney Bradley J Jansen in court via zoom for Raymond A. Tourtillott.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court notes Def. is represented by two Atty's in separate matters. Atty Jansen notes Def. may be in Shawano County Jail. State requests adjournment. JA will set up zoom with Shawano County Jail. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls  20CM138, 20CM139 & 20CM195 @ 1:35 pm.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Catherine Tang in court for Raymond A. Tourtillott., via zoom.  Atty Teng advise def. is in treatment. Court now calls 22CF10. Atty Tang does not represent def. Status on CM & AIA on Felony case.  Mandatory Appearance for def. on next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.  No contact with any Walmart stores.

10:47 AM/Rm. 203/Defendant Raymond A. Tourtillott in court with attorney Catherine Tang.  Defendant Raymond A. Tourtillott in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raymond A. Tourtillott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Def. and Def.'s Atty. and Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22-CF-10, 20-CM-195, 20-CM-138 and 20-CM-139.  Def.'s Atty. has received competency report and has discussed with Def.  Def.'s Atty. stipulates that Def. is competent to proceed.  Court finds Def. is competenct to proceed on the misdemeanor cases that the evaluation was done on.  22-CF-10/Def. has not received a copy of complaint.  Copy to be sent to Def. at jail.  Court advises Def. of charges and penalties.  Court gives Def. right to attorney.  It is unsure if Atty. Tang can represent Def. on the new case.  Court advises Def. to contact public defender if he is asking for a public defender on the new case.  Court advises Def. of other options for attorney.  State stipulates to competency findings and asks Court finds Def. competent to proceed.  Prior ruling stands.  Bond recommendations.  Misd. cases set for St. Conf. same time as AIA on new case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls 20CM138, 20CM139, 20CM195 & 22CF10 @ 01:44 PM Attorney Catherine Tang in court, via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. is in Shawano County Jail.  Competency Issue and needs to be scheduled in front of Judge Rhode.  Atty Tang can't take felony case for P.D. DA's will complete Writ.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 10:45 am.
